tuya_api_auth_failed.title: Tuya API Authentication Failed
tuya_api_auth_failed.description:
The Tuya Cloud API authentication failed for **{entry_title}**.

This usually means your API credentials (Client ID or Client Secret) are incorrect or expired.

**To fix this:**
1. Click "Submit" below to open the re-authentication dialog
2. Verify your credentials in the [Tuya IoT Platform](https://iot.tuya.com/)
3. Enter the correct Client ID and Client Secret

**Common causes:**
- Incorrect Client ID or Client Secret
- Expired API credentials
- Account suspended

confirm.title: Fix Tuya API Authentication
confirm.description: Click Submit to open the re-authentication dialog for **{entry_title}**.

tuya_api_wrong_region.title: Tuya API Wrong Region/Endpoint
tuya_api_wrong_region.description:
The Tuya Cloud API signature validation failed for **{entry_title}**.

Current endpoint: `{current_endpoint}`

This usually means you selected the wrong data center region for your Tuya account.

**To fix this:**
1. Click "Submit" below
2. Select the correct region where your Tuya devices are registered
3. The integration will automatically update and reconnect

**Common causes:**
- Wrong data center selected during setup
- Devices registered in different region
- System time not synchronized

confirm_region.title: Select Correct Region
confirm_region.description:

Current endpoint: `{current_endpoint}`

local_key_expired.title: Local Key Expired or Invalid
local_key_expired.description:
The local key authentication failed for device **{entry_title}** (ID: `{device_id}`).

This usually happens after:
- Device factory reset
- Device removed and re-added in Smart Life/Tuya app
- Local key manually changed

**To fix this:**
1. Click "Submit" below
2. Enter the new local key from your device
3. You can find the local key using the Tuya IoT Platform or tinytuya wizard

**How to get the local key:**
- Use [tinytuya wizard](https://github.com/jasonacox/tinytuya)
- Check Tuya IoT Platform → Cloud → API Explorer → Get Device Details
